paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on KCNH2 variants associated with long QT syndrome, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: A422T and H562P are two LQT-associated KCNH2 missense mutations that disrupt hERG protein trafficking to cell surface membrane.

functional_data.summary: The A422T mutation showed increased sensitivity to FHND004, with an IC50 value of 4.82 ± 0.10 μM.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The A422T mutation is known to disrupt hERG protein trafficking.
key_quotes: A422T and H562P are two LQT-associated KCNH2 missense mutations that disrupt hERG protein trafficking to cell surface membrane.
The IC50 values for FHND004 were dropped from 8.46 ± 0.33 to 4.82 ± 0.10 and 2.80 ± 0.06 μM, respectively.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: A422T and H562P are two LQT-associated KCNH2 missense mutations that disrupt hERG protein trafficking to cell surface membrane.

functional_data.summary: The H562P mutation showed increased sensitivity to FHND004, with an IC50 value of 2.80 ± 0.06 μM.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The H562P mutation is known to disrupt hERG protein trafficking.
key_quotes: A422T and H562P are two LQT-associated KCNH2 missense mutations that disrupt hERG protein trafficking to cell surface membrane.
The IC50 values for FHND004 were dropped from 8.46 ± 0.33 to 4.82 ± 0.10 and 2.80 ± 0.06 μM, respectively.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data on KCNH2 variants were successfully extracted.
